newsitem.title: UK: UK CBI sees no need for higher UK interest rates.
newsitem.headline: UK CBI sees no need for higher UK interest rates.

text.p: The Confederation of British Industry (CBI) said it saw no need for an increase in UK interest rates and it welcomed the fact that rates appeared to have been left unchanged after Wednesday's monetary meeting.

"There is certainly no need for the Chancellor to increase interest rates on the basis of this report," Alastair Eperon, head of the CBI distributive trades survey panel, told reporters after presenting a survey showing retail sales rose in August.
The Bank of England operated in money markets at unchanged rates this morning, suggesting official rates had been left at 5.75 percent at yesterday's monetary meeting.
Asked if he was happy to see rates held steady, Eperon said:
"That's exactly what we would like to see. There's no need to fear an increase in inflation yet. We're certainly not seeing 1980s-style boom conditions."
